page.title: 02STOCKPORT GRAMMAR SCHOOL
page.content: { }The original site of{Stockport {Grammar School}is near the General Post Office in Underbank in the heart of Stockport. In 1826 a new site was found 1 mile away opposite the Town Hall. The present site has been in existence since 1914. The first of the presently used buildings was built in the form of two storeys of brick built classrooms and laboratories around a stone flagged quadrangle, one side opening onto a cloistered walkway. The Hallam Hall was the focus but today is used as a library and occasionally as a function room. In 1980, the nearby Girls' Convent School was bought in order to accomodate the first intake of girls to the first year. The school now contains nearly 1000 pupils.
